item.title: Jack Bauer Wrecks Trek
item.description: It is a truth universally acknowledged that Star Trek tells us more about American foreign policy than it does about the future. I have recently had occasion to read a couple of Trek novels for the first time in years and I find that ...

item.title: My Mate V-Mate?
item.description: How do you get video from your old VHS tapes to your ultra-modern digital gadgets? SanDisk’s solution is a little gadget called a V-Mate: a little box with card-reader slots in the front and analogue TV connectors in the back.

item.title: Refactor, Redesign, Restyle
item.description: Yes, I have redesigned my archive pages—that is, the ones where all the entries apart from the most recent live, and the index pages for navigating between them. To see the new look you can visit the archive page for this entry.

item.title: OpenID in a WSGI filter
item.description: With all this buzz about OpenID all of a sudden I have been reminded of how a while back I was tinkering with a TurboGears-based web game using OpenID (see parts 1, 2, 3). Having learned more about WSGI and Python Paste I am ...

item.title: Birds of a Feather
item.description: I’m still abuzz after the Oxford Geeks Nights #1 last night. Working as I do in the slime pits of Microsoft Windows ASP.NET, it was exciting just seeing so many Macs lined up on the stage, their little apple logos glowing in the ...

item.title: Desktop Web Server in .Net
item.description: Web servers started as a solution to getting information from other sites. Then it became convenient to use HTML and HTTP on one’s local-area network, and for some reason we had to call that idea an ‘intranet’ to make people pay ...
